other_tests.findings: The liver demonstrates mildly increased echogenicity, suggesting mild fatty infiltration. The gallbladder contains a large stone measuring 21 mm. No evidence of gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid is seen. The gallbladder has a folded appearance at the fundus. No dilatation of intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ducts is noted.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The stone does not move from the neck of the gallbladder despite repositioning. Previous studies did not have evidence of gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid.
